By and large, communications are just emerging, just beginning
to reach the threshold of a worldwide explosion. There are a
number of good departments and schools of communication in the
colleges and universities of this country. There are some 150
institutions of higher education that offer degrees in one or more
phases of broadcast communications. Many of you are enrolled in
some of these good departments.
But there is not, in this country, or anywhere in the world, a
single center that offers to you, to the communications industry, to
government, both domestic and foreign, to education, to the pro¬
fessions, to all tne varied fields and areas needing communications
expertise, the kind of communications training, experiences and
services most vitally needed in the world today.
Let me review for you some of these needs:
International Service: There is a stress on communications through
out the world, the sending of people from many countries to study in the
United States, the dispersal of these people to various colleges and
universities, and the lack of a comprehensive program to serve all the
needs of these people at any given institution.
